citations.narrative:
On the morning of March 8, 2025, during daily observations, it was found that Lucy, an Eurasian Eagle Owl, acquired on
June 30, 2017, had escaped her enclosure where netting had partially detached from a wooden beam. Lucy was found in
a residential yard on March 11 and was taken to a local humane society. She was retrieved by the facility on March 12
and retained in a suitable enclosure. Their attending veterinarian examined Lucy on March 14 and submitted bloodwork
for analysis; the exam and results were unremarkable. The enclosure was modified and reinforced on March 19.
Afterwards, Lucy was returned to the enclosure.
Escaped birds have a heightened risk of injury or death, especially if they are unaccustomed to free-living.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. The
primary enclosures must be kept in good repair and contain the birds securely.
Corrected on March 19, 2025, and forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility manager.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
On the morning of March 8, 2025, during daily observations, it was found that Lucy, an Eurasian Eagle Owl, acquired on 
June 30, 2017, had escaped her enclosure where netting had partially detached from a wooden beam. Lucy was found in 
a residential yard on March 11 and was taken to a local humane society. She was retrieved by the facility on March 12 
and retained in a suitable enclosure. Their attending veterinarian examined Lucy on March 14 and submitted bloodwork 
for analysis; the exam and results were unremarkable. The enclosure was modified and reinforced on March 19. 
Afterwards, Lucy was returned to the enclosure.  
 
Escaped birds have a heightened risk of injury or death, especially if they are unaccustomed to free-living. 
 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. The 
primary enclosures must be kept in good repair and contain the birds securely. 
 
Corrected on March 19, 2025, and forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility manager.
